==== Cognitive remediation ====
Theoretical principles :

- Inherited from neurology, neuropsychology and CBT

- Closer to rehabilitation techniques

- Aims to improve functional disability linked to cognitive impairment

Practical methods :

- Training impaired cognitive processes

- Reinforcement of preserved processes (compensation for impaired cognitive processes)

Cognitive functions concerned :

- General

o Memory

o Caution

o Executive functions

- Specific to certain disorders (e.g. schizophrenia)

o Metacognition

o Social cognition

properties.question: Which of the following best describes the primary goal of cognitive remediation therapy?
properties.option_a: To enhance physical rehabilitation after injury
properties.option_b: To improve functional disability linked to cognitive impairment
properties.option_c: To provide long-term pharmacological treatment for cognitive issues
properties.option_d: To focus exclusively on improving memory through rote memorization techniques
